title: Thunderbird extremely slow to open on MAC
content:
Hello, I've been using Thunderbird since it first came out may years ago and have been a satisfied user. Sometime in the past year, after one of the Thunderbird updates, Thunderbird became EXTERMELY slow to open. It takes over a minute. I have looked for solutions here for the past year...no luck (I've read through most all of them here, that have to do with slowness of Thunderbird opening, as well as on Reddit). I've tried basic troubleshooting e.g. clearing Thunderbird cache, increasing cache to huge size. I've seen references to the slowness being related to "multiple calendars". I don't use calendars on Thunnderbird and went as far as to delete/disable the default one that was there. Still no improvement. I know its a Thunderbird specific problem since:

a. I don't have this slowness opening any other program on my Mac (opening it or using it) b. I don't have a problem with performance of Thunderbird once it finally opens c. It all started in 2022 immediately after one of the Thunderbird updates.

I am on: Mac Air M1, Ventura 13.2, 16 GB Ram Thunderbird 102.14.0 (64-bit)

I hate to ditch Thunderbird after using it all these years and being a very early user since it came out, but I am at wits end. Any help is appreciated. Thanks for any help in advance!
creator: msq58

title: Can I "Unburden" Thunderbird?
content:
I have a very small Tablet computer and Thunderbird is really bogged down on it. The tablet has a 32 bit processor, 1G RAM, 64G SD drive. (1) When I run TB I get many "not responding" messages from Windows. (2) Maybe 1/2 the time, if I "delete" a message the screen will freeze on the message. The message is removed from the inbox list. I have to click "X" to get rid of that screen. (3) Get Messages no longer works. When I click it, nothing happens. The status bar at the bottom remains on the last information displayed. I found that if I use View, Folders, All, I can bump TB to get messages. (Normally I use Unified Folders) The status bar will display each of the accounts it is checking and any new messages will appear. These things have been happening through many many versions of TB. Although #3 seemed fixed a few weeks ago but has returned. Same for #2.

I looked at the disk space that TB is using and found that TB is using over 10GB. See attached. I don't know why it is so large. I don't need to store any messages on this computer. I have a desktop that is my "base station" where I want to save all (but deleted) messages.

I don't know if this large amount of TB space is contributing to the problem. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: petejc

title: Thunderbird Recent History
content:
Why have a function like "Clear Recent History" when it does NOTHING? I would think Clearing Recent History WOULD clear recent history. It DOES NOT. Does NOTHING. Try it. Run something like Ccleaner and see that there is NOTHING cleared from Thunderbird History.

So, why have it if it does NOTHING?

I have recently had ALL my data stolen when BOTH CalPERS' AND CMS/Medicare's file transfer provider was hacked, so I am fighting against ANY form of internet presence being tracked/followed/gleaned, but Thunderbird has apparently forgotten to provide means to remove previous links/websites/providers' from current history.

I realize I "may" be over-reacting, but "internet history" leans toward, "No, I am NOT"

Thanks,

Oldheart43
creator: oldheart43

title: Window scaling on MacOS wrong
content:
I have an issue with the size/scaling of the thunderbird window, including fonts and controls. I tried to apply the fix mentioned in both

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1365299 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1356519

to update layout.css.devPixelsPerPx to something large. A value between 1.1 and 1.7 sort of works, but not consistently.

I use a Retina MacBook with external screens. Thunderbird seems to counter the efforts that MacOS puts in to make windows appear a similar size on screens with different pixel densities. So I end up constantly adjusting that advanced setting depending whether I have the thunderbird window on the builtin laptop screen or an external monitor. In addition every setup with 1, 2 or 3 monitors gives a different window scaling. Not a small effect, the difference is between only seeing the first 20 characters of each line in an email (that is large on a 27" screen) to an unreadably small font size.

There must be a better way to fix this for MacOS. Other applications can do it. Including my own python qt apps.
creator: tsr-firefox

title: Thunderbird freezing up regularly
content:
I am using Thunderbird (v102.14.0 - 32 bit) on Windows 10. It regularly freezes up (like every few minutes) while some background process is working. In Windows task manager during these lockups I see that Thunderbird is consuming a large percentage of machine resources and using over a gigabyte of memory (but no disk activity). After a minute or two, it apparently gets done with whatever background process it is doing, and everything is normal again.

For what it's worth, I notice that when this happens other mozilla apps like Open Office Writer and Open Office Calc are also locked up. So whatever is going on it must be part of the common kernel used by Thunderbird and these other apps.

This behavior just seemed to begin recently (last several months), and it makes trying to use Thunderbird and writing emails very frustrating and time-consuming. Whatever background process that is executing needs to be changed so that it is a non-blocking thread so the rest of the program functionality still works while it is executing.
creator: paulfranklinherman

title: "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead" with Oauth (gmail) account
content:
Hi, The institution where I work makes me change my password. So I did, and I expected TB to ask me the new password (previously of that TB was working fine). Every time it tries to login, I get this message, no matter what I do:

Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead

Thunderbird detected a potential security threat and did not continue to id-provider.uoc.edu. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.

What I try:

  • Delete and add the account of the problem
  • delete all the passwords of ALL the accounts and add them again
  • Reinstall TB (recycling prefs.js and all the .MAB files in the profile) (previous version was 102.something, current one is 115.1.1., same problem in both)
  • Make a new profile using the prefs.js of the other laptop (where it works properly)
  • Make a totally new profile just to test the account alone.

Nothing changes, same behavior.

Additional information: In my second laptop it worked fine, I could login easily after changing the password. Is still on 102.14.0, I don't dare update it yet. My institution works with google, so I usually login in my institution and then in google in the popup windows. This is how it works in TB in my other laptop, is the normal behavior. I have 2 more google accounts, and 2 more institutional outlook (microsoft) accounts (another institution). All of them work with Oauth2 perfectly fine. So I know this this is not the problem (I have no internal server in my PC, also). This This didn't help also, but I think is not exactly the same problem, some Oauth2 account works fine in my laptop, is just this one.

So, My guess is that somehow my TB doesn't allow non direct connections to google accounts (through my institution, in this case) and consider it some kind of scam. But it worked in my other laptop, so...

Any help, please? I have a lot of accounts and I need to work with thunderbird to manage them all!

Thank you
creator: fellipecorr

title: Import mail da Outlook si ferma a 6.033.766.701 byte
content:
Ciao a tutti, sto cercando di importare le email da un profilo Outlook 2021 x64 utilizzando l'ultima versione di Thunderbird (115.1.1). La procedura di import si avvia correttamente e dal Task Manager posso vedere il processo lavorare; il file (C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\xxxx\Mail\Local Folders\Import Outlookxxxx.sbd\xxxxx.sbd) del profilo locale di Thunderbird aumenta di dimensione man mano che vengono importate le email. Dopo diversi minuti però tutto si ferma, il processo smette di lavorare ed il file di import su filesystem si blocca a 6.033.766.701 byte.

Thunderbird non restiuisce messaggi di errore e la finestra di avanzamento resta ferma allo 0%

Il file di origine è un PST da 36GB

Avete qualche suggerimento? Grazie
creator: magnum2000

title: One Message filter for multiple email accounts (one message filter to rule them all)
content:
I use various email addresses to run my business. For example -A general correspondence email, invoice email, events email and a bookings email. These have multiple folders and I use message filters to file correspondence into various folders. Currently there is no easy way to write one message filter rule and apply it to multiple email addresses. I can send corresponded from one email address to another using the filter but to manage multiple chains of correspondence from the same client, I have to write the same rule into all the email accounts separately. My dream is to write one message filter and select the email accounts to apply this one rule too.

I want to be able to apply one rule to rule them all.

For example - Spam - I currently have a message filter that grabs 16 plus phrases and sends them to spam but i have to create this rule multiple times for multiple email addresses - i should be able to apply it to all or a select number of email addresses. Can anyone help
